Led the end-to-end design, development, and optimisation of the Equifax UK D2C website, driving improved UX, product enhancements, and business performance.

• Spearheaded website redesign projects, increasing conversion rates by up to 58% through UX best practices and CRO strategies.
  • Conducted A/B and multivariate testing, usability analysis, and user research to refine user flows and product features.
  • Designed responsive, cross-platform interfaces for mobile and desktop, ensuring accessible, SEO-friendly experiences.
  • Implemented scalable front-end architectures using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
  • Managed end-to-end website development and maintenance, including coding, debugging, release cycles, and performance optimisation.
  • Integrated front-end with back-end systems and coordinated with marketing and analytics teams (Glassbox, Google Analytics) to track KPIs and identify growth opportunities.
  • Acted as the sole UX designer for product and marketing initiatives, owning the design process and driving improvements to registration and conversion funnels.
  • Led content updates and optimised workflows to support flexibility and collaboration across platforms.

Tools & Technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, AngularJS, SEO, Adobe Creative Cloud, GIT, Jira, Google Analytics (GA4), A/B Testing, Glassbox, CMS Technologies (Contentful, HubSpot, Custom CMS at Equifax)

Designed and implemented the ‘Spring-A-Story’ web application, empowering children to develop reading independence through technology.

• Designed and developed the ‘Spring-A-Story’ application using HTML, CSS, PHP, and JavaScript, focusing on usability for young users.
  • Collaborated with experts in Human-Computer Interaction and Psychology to ensure that the application was both user-friendly and educationally effective.
  • Conducted user research (focus groups, surveys, and testing), iterating on the application to better meet user needs.
  • Presented research findings, contributing to the academic discourse on technology and child development.
  • Participated in the IDC2020 Workshop on AI, Robotics, and Children’s Critical Reflections, gaining valuable insights into the impact of technology on children's development.

Technologies & Tools: HTML, jQuery, Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience (UX), JavaScript, CSS
*Find out more about the project Rubegni, E., Dore, R., Landoni, M. and Kan, L., 2020. “The girl who wants to fly”: Exploring the role of digital technology in enhancing dialogic reading. International Journal of Child-Computer Interaction, p.100239*

Specialised in Human-Computer-Interactions and Web Applications. My thesis was focused on designing and developing a wordless picture book application for young children. The course provided the fundamentals of software and hardware computing solutions for real-world problems. This includes understanding operating systems and database systems (SQL, NoSQL) creating programs using C#, C++, and Java. As well as creating mobile and web applications by using programming languages such as HTML, XML, CSS and JavaScript. Apart from this also studying artificial intelligence (Lisp, Prolog) and human-computer interactions. Therefore, developing mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills for the computing industry.

I’m Ling Kan, a London-based digital leader with a unique blend of technical expertise, creative flair, and a passion for crafting exceptional user experiences. With a background in computer science and a natural knack for design, I bring a distinctive perspective to every project—seamlessly merging technical precision with artistic vision to deliver impactful, user-centric solutions.

Over the years, I’ve built a diverse career spanning UX design, product management, web development, and marketing. I’ve led website redesigns, launched innovative products, and driven strategic initiatives that enhance SEO, boost user engagement, and improve conversion rates (CRO). My hands-on experience with tools like Google Analytics, Glassbox, and AI heat maps enables me to uncover valuable insights and optimise customer journeys with data-driven precision.

What sets me apart is my ability to connect the dots between strategy, creativity, and technology. From managing cross-functional teams to delivering end-to-end solutions, I thrive on turning complex challenges into opportunities for growth. My marketing experience has sharpened my storytelling skills, while my technical background ensures every solution is scalable, efficient, and future-proof.

I take a lean, collaborative approach to problem-solving, fostering high-performing teams and delivering value efficiently. Whether designing a user interface, analysing website performance, or leading a product launch, I’m dedicated to creating digital experiences that inspire and drive results.
